trans-unit.source: Configure a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service that uses Traffic Manager
trans-unit.target: Configure a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service that uses Traffic Manager

trans-unit.source: Use a custom domain name for an a web app in Azure App Service that includes Traffic Manager for load balancing.
trans-unit.target: Use a custom domain name for an a web app in Azure App Service that includes Traffic Manager for load balancing.

trans-unit.source: Configuring a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service using Traffic Manager
trans-unit.target: Configuring a custom domain name for a web app in Azure App Service using Traffic Manager

trans-unit.source: This article provides generic instructions for using a custom domain name with Azure App Service that use Traffic Manager for load balancing.
trans-unit.target: This article provides generic instructions for using a custom domain name with Azure App Service that use Traffic Manager for load balancing.

trans-unit.source: Understanding DNS records
trans-unit.target: Understanding DNS records

trans-unit.source: Configure your web apps for standard mode
trans-unit.target: Configure your web apps for standard mode

trans-unit.source: Add a DNS record for your custom domain
trans-unit.target: Add a DNS record for your custom domain

trans-unit.source: If you have purchased domain through Azure App Service Web Apps then skip following steps and refer to the final step of <html></html>Buy Domain for Web Apps<html></html> article.
trans-unit.target: If you have purchased domain through Azure App Service Web Apps then skip following steps and refer to the final step of <html></html>Buy Domain for Web Apps<html></html> article.

trans-unit.source: To associate your custom domain with a web app in Azure App Service, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by the domain registrar that you purchased your domain name from.
trans-unit.target: To associate your custom domain with a web app in Azure App Service, you must add a new entry in the DNS table for your custom domain by using tools provided by the domain registrar that you purchased your domain name from.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to locate and use the DNS tools.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to locate and use the DNS tools.

trans-unit.source: Log on to your account at your domain registrar, and look for a page for managing DNS records.
trans-unit.target: Log on to your account at your domain registrar, and look for a page for managing DNS records.

trans-unit.source: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.
trans-unit.target: Look for links or areas of the site labeled as Domain Name, DNS, or Name Server Management.

trans-unit.source: Often a link to this page can be found be viewing your account information, and then looking for a link such as My domains.
trans-unit.target: Often a link to this page can be found be viewing your account information, and then looking for a link such as My domains.

trans-unit.source: Once you have found the management page for your domain name, look for a link that allows you to edit the DNS records.
trans-unit.target: Once you have found the management page for your domain name, look for a link that allows you to edit the DNS records.

trans-unit.source: This might be listed as a Zone file, DNS Records, or as an Advanced configuration link.
trans-unit.target: This might be listed as a Zone file, DNS Records, or as an Advanced configuration link.

trans-unit.source: The page will most likely have a few records already created, such as an entry associating '@' or '\*' with a 'domain parking' page.
trans-unit.target: The page will most likely have a few records already created, such as an entry associating '@' or '\*' with a 'domain parking' page.

trans-unit.source: It may also contain records for common sub-domains such as www.
trans-unit.target: It may also contain records for common sub-domains such as www.

trans-unit.source: The page will mention CNAME records, or provide a drop-down to select a record type.
trans-unit.target: The page will mention CNAME records, or provide a drop-down to select a record type.

trans-unit.source: It may also mention other records such as A records and MX records.
trans-unit.target: It may also mention other records such as A records and MX records.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, CNAME records will be called by other names such as an Alias Record.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, CNAME records will be called by other names such as an Alias Record.

trans-unit.source: The page will also have fields that allow you to map from a Host name or Domain name to another domain name.
trans-unit.target: The page will also have fields that allow you to map from a Host name or Domain name to another domain name.

trans-unit.source: While the specifics of each registrar vary, in general you map from your custom domain name (such as contoso.com,) to the Traffic Manager domain name (contoso.trafficmanager.net) that is used for your web app.
trans-unit.target: While the specifics of each registrar vary, in general you map from your custom domain name (such as contoso.com,) to the Traffic Manager domain name (contoso.trafficmanager.net) that is used for your web app.

trans-unit.source: Once you have finished adding or modifying DNS records at your registrar, save the changes.
trans-unit.target: Once you have finished adding or modifying DNS records at your registrar, save the changes.

trans-unit.source: Enable Traffic Manager
trans-unit.target: Enable Traffic Manager

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
